did.abstract: Correspondence, orders, reports, memoranda, personnel records, printed matter, maps, and photographs relating to American naval aviation, especially in the Pacific Theater during World War II, and to post-war naval administration of Guam.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Vice admiral, United States Navy; commander, Air Force, Pacific Fleet, 1944; governor of Guam, 1946-1949.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, orders, reports, memoranda, personnel records, printed matter, maps, and photographs relating to American naval aviation, especially in the Pacific Theater during World War II, and to post-war naval administration of Guam.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Formerly security-classified records of the U.S. government, released in full or in part. Includes some interfield, unclassified government records. Arranged chronologically by date of release by Hoover, thereunder chronologically by date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Consists of two maps: "Areas Proposed for Permanent Use and Occupation by the Armed Forces on Guam," Marianas Area Base Development Department, 18 August 1947; and "Army Real Estate Requirements, Tumon Bay Recreational Area, Land Square 14, Section 2, Municipality of Dededo," U.S. Naval Government of Guam, M.I., Land and Claims Commission, 1 April 1948.
